items: Understand what Boolean values (True / False) are
Learn the three main Boolean operators: and, or, not
Combine multiple conditions in if statements

sections.heading: Booleans in Python
paragraphs: A Boolean is a type of value that can be only one of two things: True or False.
Boolean values are the building blocks of decision-making in Python.

sections.heading: Boolean Operators
rows: True if at least one is true

sections.heading: Real-life analogy
bullets: and → I will go outside if it’s sunny AND I have free time.
or → I will eat dessert if I have ice cream OR cake.
not → I will go to bed if I’m not tired.

sections.heading: Try it
bullets: Make two variables: is_sunny = True, have_free_time = False.
Use if with and to check if both are true before printing "Go outside."
Use or to check if at least one is true before printing "Relax time!"
Use not to check if a value is false and print a message.
Change the values of the variables and see how the results change.
or → needs at least one condition true

questions.prompt: What does the and operator require to return True?
choices: At least one condition is true

questions.prompt: Which operator would you use if you want a condition to be true when at least one part is true?
